content.description: This is a nice moderate outing up a cool feature. Start up some flakes, past a couple bolts, to a final crack before the anchor.
content.protection: 3 bolts, a finger-sized cam or two.
content.location: When approaching the Industrial Wall, go right at the Finger Crack Boulder instead of left. It'll be right in front of you.

content.description: Climb an initial slab, through a small roof and finish with interesting moves to the anchor.
content.location: Second route from the right on the Industrial Wall. Starts above a grassy ledge.

content.description:
Climb up the slab to a bolt, then over a small roof. Continue up thoughtful moves along the right trending weakness until you get to an anchor on the nice face below the big roof.

The route used to continue up through the hollow roof to a higher anchor, but the anchor has since been lowered to avoid climbing on such a big, hollow feature that one day would likely have come off with someone attached to it. The "new" version of the climb doesn't have the fun roof but is still worth doing, and much safer.
content.location: Start where the trail meets the base of the wall, at the second fixed line.

content.description: Probably the easiest route on the Industrial Wall. Climb the slabby face to a steeper face above and enjoy the shaded, scenic perch of this little wall.
content.location: The rightmost route on the Industrial Wall, starting above a grassy ledge.

content.description:
The original description was removed for unclear reasons.

If someone wants to take over this page, we can reassign it to you.  Contact an admin if you want this page.
Climb up through the steep overlaps to the crux at the 3rd bolt. Once past this, move right, then left under the hanging garden, and up to the anchors at the top of the wall.
content.location:
The next climb right of

Bomb the World

.

content.description: Start where the fixed line ends, below an obvious chimney halfway up the cliff. Climb up the steeper rock for a few moves before making your way into the corner below the chimney. Climb good features on the right side of the chimney to the anchor.
content.location: Follow the trail to the fixed lines, and then take the lines to where they end. This route sits right above.
